      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        We use this method to update player's bullet coordinates When the player is shooting is false, the bullet's coordinates it will update in the same way as the player's coordinates. When the player is not shooting the bullet it will move only forward in X-direction. Be aware that you have only one bullet and it will be recharged only when it is off the screen or it is HAPPY TO KILL AN ENEMY, so point and shoot first. :D:D:D

      • drawGameObject

        public void drawGameObject(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           java.awt.Color objectColor)
        It is used to draw the player
        Specified by:
        drawGameObject in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        Graphics - g
        Player - player - the player we want to draw(using the coordinates from the player object)
        Color - playerColor - the color we want for the player's body
        Color - gunColor - the color we want for the enemy's body
